title: Assessment of nucleotide/nucleoside analog intervention in primer-dependent viral RNA-dependent RNA polymerases
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
SARS-CoV-2 in vitro primer-dependent polymerase assays
Timing: 90 min
In this section, we set up a primer-dependent RdRP assay for assessment of NTP forms of NAs.
An RdRP assay to characterize the NTP form of sofosbuvir (SOF-TP) intervention.
Thaw and/or keep all the reagents on ice.
Prepare a reaction pre-mix containing HEPES (pH 7.0), MgCl2, DTT, and NaCl in a single tube. Mix thoroughly on ice.
Prepare an enzyme mix of nsp12, nsp7, and nsp8 with a molar ratio of 1:1:2 in a single tube. Mix thoroughly on ice.
Prepare an NTP mix (CTP, UTP/SOF-TP, and ATP, 2 mM each) by adding an equal volume of each NTP/NA solution (6 mM stock) in a single tube. Mix thoroughly on ice.
Add 2 μL T33-8/P10 RNA construct to the 14 μL reaction pre-mix. Mix thoroughly on ice.
Add 1 μL enzyme mix to “e”. Mix thoroughly on ice.
Add 3 μL NTP mix to “f” to make a total volume of 20 μL for 1 reaction. Mix thoroughly on ice.

Incubate the reaction at 25°C for different time (5, 40, or 90 min in the case of SOF-TP assessment). For each reaction time point, a 20-μI aliquot is withdrawn from the reaction mixture and immediately quenched with equal volume of 2 × stop solution. Mix thoroughly on ice.

An RdRP assay to characterize the NTP form of remdesivir (RDV-TP) intervention.
Thaw and/or keep all the reagents on ice.
Prepare a reaction pre-mix containing HEPES (pH 7.0), MgCl2, DTT, and NaCl in a single tube same as the step 1 “b”. Mix thoroughly on ice.
Prepare an enzyme mix of nsp12, nsp7, and nsp8 with a molar ratio of 1:1:2 in a single tube same as the step 1 “c”. Mix thoroughly on ice.
Prepare an NTP mix (CTP, ATP or RDV-TP, and GTP, 2 mM each) by adding an equal volume of each NTP/NA solution (6 mM stock) in a single tube. Mix thoroughly on ice.
Add 2 μL T33-1/P10 RNA construct to the 14 μL reaction pre-mix. Mix thoroughly on ice.
Add the enzyme mix 1 μL to “e”. Mix thoroughly on ice.
Add the NTP mix 3 μL to “f” to make a total volume of 20 μL for 1 reaction. Mix thoroughly on ice.

Incubate the reaction at 25°C for different time (20, 60, or 90 min in the case of RDV-TP assessment). For each reaction time point, a 20-μI aliquot is withdrawn from the reaction mixture and immediately quenched with equal volume of 2 × stop solution. Mix thoroughly on ice.
Store the quenched samples at 4°C for 60 min or at −20°C for overnight prior to denaturing PAGE analysis.
Critical: Take every possible consideration to avoiding RNase contamination (wear gloves, use RNase-free tips and tubes, use DEPC-treated H2O when necessary.).
Preparation of 20% (w/v) polyacrylamide/7 M urea gel
Timing: 1 h
In this section, we set up a method for preparation of 20% (w/v) polyacrylamide/7 M urea denaturing gel.
Weigh 2.1 g urea and transfer it into a 15 mL centrifuge tube, and then add 1 mL 5 × TBE buffer and 2.5 mL 19:1 acrylamide/bisacrylamide 40% (w/v) solution to the tube to make a 5-mL polyacrylamide solution.
Mix the polyacrylamide solution thoroughly by a multi-purpose rotary shaker until urea is dissolved completely.
Add 20 μL 10% (w/v) APS and 2.5 μL TEMED to step “4”. Mix thoroughly.
Pour the mixture immediately into the glass sandwich plates.
Insert the comb and let the gel polymerize for at least 30 min.
Note: It is recommended to use 0.75-mm thick gel. Pre-cast gel can also be used.
Denaturing PAGE analysis
Timing: 4 h

In this section, we set up a method for resolving RNA species by denaturing PAGE.
Incubate the quenched samples at 95°C for 45 s.
Note: If the quenched samples were stored at −20°C, thaw the samples on ice prior to 95°C incubation.
Cool the samples on ice.
Note: A DNA completely complementary to the RNA template T33-1 at a molar ratio of 3:1 was added to the 20 μI quenched sample to help resolve the RNA product well. The mixture was heated at 95°C for 45 s and slowly cooled to r.t. (25°C for about 30 min) to facilitate the annealing of T33-1 template RNA and the complementary DNA.
Resolve the RNA products through 20% (w/v) polyacrylamide/7 M urea gel electrophoresis under constant voltage (200 V) at 25°C with 0.5 × TBE buffer in the upper chamber and 1 × TBE buffer in the lower chamber for about 120 min until bromophenol blue just migrates out of the vertical gel.
Critical: It is strongly recommend to prerun the gel for about 30 min until the electric current was steady, and then rinse the wells with 0.5 × TBE thoroughly just before sample loading.
Rinse the gel twice with H2O.
Stain the gel with Stains-All solution (Sigma-Aldrich) for 45 min using a horizontal rotator.
Rinse the gel twice with H2O. Destain the gel in H2O for 15 min using a horizontal rotator.
Scan the gel using a scanner (Epson Perfection V850 Pro) under the following settings for preview. And use the tone correction icon to adjust tone levels individually when necessary.
Mode: Professional Mode.
Document type: Film (with Film Area Guide).
Film type: Positive Film.
Image type: 48-bit Color.
Resolution: 300 dpi.
Target Size: Original.
Adjustments: Descreening, Backlight Correction, Dust Removal.

Analyze the gel images of expective RNA products qualitatively (see Figures 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2] and 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]). We can also analyze the gel images quantitatively using ImageJ Fiji distribution after converting them to gray-scale images.
